result.execSummary:
The defendant Mark A. Boogren was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Bail Jumping-Felony, a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(b).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

Defendant shall submit to any assessments and fully participate in any counseling deemed appropriate by the Agent and abide by any treatment recommendations.

elements

D.A. John Snider appeared for the state.
Defendant appeared in person with Atty. Nielsen.
Plea quest. and waiver of rights form filed.
The defendant enters a plea of guilty to the sole count in the information. Plea accepted by the Court after rights were explained, and defendant found guilty.
The Court sentences the defendant to 6 years in the Wisconsin State Prison System.
ITOC - 3 years
EXS - 3 years
Atty. Nielsen will calculate credit and notify the clerk.
Sentence is concurrent with sentence imposed in 14 CF 145.
Conditions of extended supervision:  1)  Pay all costs and fees, 2) Undergo any treatment or counseling deemed appropriate by the agent and complete any treatment recommendations.
Defendant is eligible for Substance Abuse and Early Release programs. 
Appeal rights, WEDS form, voter and firearms restrictions were provided.

District Attorney John Snider : Present
Defendant present, in custody
Attorney  Troy Nielsen, Present
14CF278/15CF125/14CF145:  Atty Nielsen motions to amend signature bonds to cash bonds.
Court amends bond in each of those files to separate  $2000 cash bonds with same conditions, except soberlink conditions.
Amount of each bond will remain the same.

Shall report immediately to Sheriff's Dept. for booking.  
Defendant shall not operate a motor vehicle on a highway in this State unless authorized to do so by M.V.D.  
Defendant shall not operate a motor vehicle anywhere with any amount of alcohol in his/her system.  
Defendant shall not operate a motor vehicle anywhere with any detectable amount of restricted controlled substances in blood.
